LayoutNode.Content: The Call for Papers is now closed
LayoutNode.SRC: The Call for Papers is now closed

LayoutNode.Content: The 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Education (AIED 2011) is the next in a longstanding series of biennial international conferences for high quality research in intelligent systems and cognitive science for education and training applications. The conference provides opportunities for the cross-fertilization of approaches, techniques and ideas from the many areas that make up this interdisciplinary research field, including: agent technologies, artificial intelligence, computer science, cognitive and learning sciences, education, educational technologies, game design, psychology, philosophy, sociology, anthropology, linguistics, and the many domain-specific areas for which AIED systems have been designed, deployed and evaluated.
LayoutNode.SRC: The 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Education (AIED 2011) is the next in a longstanding series of biennial international conferences for high quality research in intelligent systems and cognitive science for education and training applications. The conference provides opportunities for the cross-fertilization of approaches, techniques and ideas from the many areas that make up this interdisciplinary research field, including: agent technologies, artificial intelligence, computer science, cognitive and learning sciences, education, educational technologies, game design, psychology, philosophy, sociology, anthropology, linguistics, and the many domain-specific areas for which AIED systems have been designed, deployed and evaluated.

LayoutNode.Content: To reflect these broad interests that combine advanced technology with advanced understanding of learners, learning, and the context of learning, the theme of AIED 2011 is "Next Generation Learning Environments: Supporting Cognitive, Metacognitive, Social and Affective Aspects of Learning".
LayoutNode.SRC: To reflect these broad interests that combine advanced technology with advanced understanding of learners, learning, and the context of learning, the theme of AIED 2011 is "Next Generation Learning Environments: Supporting Cognitive, Metacognitive, Social and Affective Aspects of Learning".

LayoutNode.Content: We invite submissions to the AIED 2011 conference, which will be held 28 June - 2 July 2011, in Auckland, New Zealand.
LayoutNode.SRC: We invite submissions to the AIED 2011 conference, which will be held 28 June - 2 July 2011, in Auckland, New Zealand.

LayoutNode.Content: Models of learners, facilitators, tasks and problem-solving processes
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Models of learners, facilitators, tasks and problem-solving processes

LayoutNode.Content: Models of groups and communities for learning
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Models of groups and communities for learning

LayoutNode.Content: Modelling motivation, metacognition, and affective aspects of learning
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Modelling motivation, metacognition, and affective aspects of learning

LayoutNode.Content: Representing and analysing discourse during learning
Interactive pedagogical agents and learning companions
Agents that promote metacognition, motivation and affect
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Agents that promote metacognition, motivation and affect

LayoutNode.Content: Domain-specific learning applications (e.g. language, mathematics, science, medicine, military, industry).
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Domain-specific learning applications (e.g. language, mathematics, science, medicine, military, industry).

LayoutNode.Content: Full papers (8 pages) - All submissions should describe original and unpublished work.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Full papers (8 pages) - All submissions should describe original and unpublished work.

LayoutNode.Content: Posters (3 pages) - Authors are encouraged to submit reports on work-in-progress including, where possible, early results.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Posters (3 pages) - Authors are encouraged to submit reports on work-in-progress including, where possible, early results.

LayoutNode.Content: Young researcher's track / Doctoral consortium (YRT/DC) (3 pages) - The YRT/DC is for work-in progress by graduate/postgraduate students and other young/new researchers.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Young researcher's track / Doctoral consortium (YRT/DC) (3 pages) - The YRT/DC is for work-in progress by graduate/postgraduate students and other young/new researchers.

LayoutNode.Content: Interactive events (1-2 pages) - To showcase interactive demonstrations of AIED systems.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Interactive events (1-2 pages) - To showcase interactive demonstrations of AIED systems.

LayoutNode.Content: Workshop proposals (2-4 pages) – Proposals for workshops on "hot" topics in AIED.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Workshop proposals (2-4 pages) – Proposals for workshops on "hot" topics in AIED.

LayoutNode.Content: Tutorial proposals (2-4 pages) – Proposals for tutorials on important AIED topics.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Tutorial proposals (2-4 pages) – Proposals for tutorials on important AIED topics.

LayoutNode.Content: Submissions will be through EasyChair. The required page format and full details for all submissions are available on the conference website.
LayoutNode.SRC: Submissions will be through EasyChair. The required page format and full details for all submissions are available on the conference website.

LayoutNode.Content: Young Researcher's Track papers: 21 Jan 2011 (23:59 GMT)
The proceedings of the AIED 2011 conference will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science/Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence.
LayoutNode.SRC: The proceedings of the AIED 2011 conference will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science/Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence.
